SENT.plain: We report the first case of cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) diagnosed in an adult with Down's syndrome (DS)
A 25-year-old man with DS was admitted because of a generalized tonic-clonic seizure and prolonged postictal period
Cerebral magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and MR venography revealed CVT
No particular cause of the thrombosis was identified
CVT may be an unusual cause of stroke in DS
